articles.author: Kanishka Singh, Andrew Mills, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that a "complete and total" ceasefire between Israel and Iran will go into force with a view to ending the conflict between the two nations.
articles.title: Trump announces Israel-Iran ceasefire

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Gleb Garanich
articles.description: Waves of Russian drones and missiles in and around Kyiv overnight killed 10 people including one child, lit up the night sky with fires in residential areas and damaged the entrance to a metro station bomb shelter, Ukrainian officials said on Monday.
articles.title: Russian attacks on Kyiv area kill 10 and injure dozens, Ukraine says

articles.author: Mike Stone
articles.description: Before strapping into the cockpit of the U.S. Air Force's B-2 Spirit stealth bomber for missions that can stretch beyond 40 hours, pilots undergo weeks of preparation that focuses not only on flight plans, but what to eat.
articles.title: Turkey sandwiches and stealth: Preparing for B-2 bomber missions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced a new defence co-production initiative on Monday during a short visit by the Ukrainian president to London to discuss his country's defence against Russia.
articles.title: Starmer and Zelenskiy meet in London, agree military production project

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un presided over the 12th plenary meeting of the eighth central committee of the ruling Workers' Party of Korea, state media reported on Tuesday.
articles.title: North Korean leader Kim presides over key party meeting, state media says

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: The NATO alliance has crafted a summit in The Hague this week to shore itself up by satisfying U.S. President Donald Trump with a big new defence spending goal - but it now risks being dominated by the repercussions of his military strikes on Iran.
articles.title: Hague NATO summit aims to focus on Trump's spending goal but Iran looms large

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Qatar's Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani secured Tehran's agreement to the U.S. proposal for a ceasefire in the conflict between Israel and Iran during a call with Iranian officials held after Iran's strikes on a U.S. air base in Qatar on Monday, an official briefed on the negotiations told Reuters early on Tuesday.
articles.title: Qatari prime minister secured Iran's agreement to US ceasefire proposal after call with Trump, official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi said on Monday that Tehran's attack on U.S military base al-Udeid in Qatar came in response to the U.S. "aggression against Iran's territorial integrity and sovereignty."
articles.title: Iran ready to respond again in case of any further action by US, foreign minister says

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: The US sought to send some deportees to politically unstable countries South Sudan and Libya.
articles.title: Supreme Court lifts limits on Trump deporting migrants to countries not their own

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Vice President JD Vance said on Monday Iran was no longer able to build a nuclear weapon after U.S. strikes destroyed its infrastructure.
articles.title: US Vice President Vance says Iran is now incapable of building a nuclear weapon -Fox
